title: Contributory Aged Parent (Temporary) visa
summary: This page provides detailed information about the Contributory Aged Parent (Temporary) Visa (Subclass 884). It explains eligibility requirements, costs, processing times, conditions, and how to apply for or transition to the permanent Subclass 864 visa. It also outlines obligations, travel rights, family inclusion rules, and recent updates to application processes via ImmiAccount.

visa_details.description: This temporary visa lets the aged parent of a settled Australian citizen, Australian permanent resident or eligible New Zealand citizen stay temporarily in Australia.
visa_details.travel_rights: Multiple entry for 2 years from the date of grant
visa_details.work_study_rights: Work and study permitted, but without government support

pathway_to_permanent_visa.notes: Subclass 884 followed by subclass 864 allows cost to be spread over several years.

important_updates.details: Applicants for Parent visa subclasses 143, 173, 804, 864 and 884 can import their paper application into ImmiAccount after lodgement. Subclass 103 applications lodged after November 2018 can also be imported.

must_have: An eligible child who is a settled Australian citizen, Australian permanent resident or eligible New Zealand citizen
Be old enough to receive the age pension in Australia
must_not_have: Already applied for or hold a Sponsored Parent (Temporary) (Subclass 870) visa

sponsor_requirements.note: Usually the sponsor is an eligible child of the applicant

application_process.apply_from: Must be in Australia, but not in immigration clearance, when applying and when the decision is made
application_process.family_members_location_requirement: Family members applying with the applicant must also be in Australia and not in immigration clearance
application_process.no_further_stay_condition: If holding a temporary visa with a no further stay condition, application is invalid unless a waiver is granted
assessment_stages: Initial assessment to check eligibility and queue placement or refusal
Final assessment when places become available
application_process.queueing: Applications are subject to capping and queueing in order received

visa_conditions.visa_label: Visa is digitally linked to passport; no physical label provided

requirements: Must include details of all family members whether migrating or not
Family applying must meet health and character requirements
Non-migrating family members might also need to meet health and character requirements
family_inclusion.newborn_child: Information available on what to do if child is born after lodging the application

costs.base_cost: From AUD 34,170.00 for a single applicant
costs.payment_structure: Paid in 2 instalments; first at application, second when requested
additional_costs: Additional charges for each family member included
links: Fees and charges for other services

processing_times.general_statement: Demand is greater than available places; processing times are lengthy
factors_delaying_processing: Non-payment or incorrect payment of visa charge

stay_information.stay_longer: Cannot extend or reapply for this visa; must apply for a different visa
stay_information.permanent_residence_warning: Do not arrange to stay permanently until visa is granted

comparative_visa_options.notes: Permanent visa; may be processed faster but costs more
Two-step process with subclass 864; costs more overall but spread out
Allows parents to visit for up to 3 or 5 years per stay, maximum 10 years cumulative

help_with_visa.advice: Review information on who can help with your visa application before paying anyone
